summary: This document appears to be a training presentation or manual from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) on suicide prevention in Special Housing Units (SHUs). It outlines objectives, risk factors for specific inmate groups (mentally ill, behavior disordered, sex offenders, protective custody), management strategies, and emergency response procedures. It is a general policy document, not specific to any individual case.
keyFacts: The document is a Bureau of Prisons training guide on suicide prevention in Special Housing Units (SHUs).
It states that 30-80% of inmate suicides occur on locked units annually.
It identifies mentally ill inmates, behaviorally disordered inmates, sex offenders, and protective custody inmates as high-risk groups for suicide.
It recommends double-celling SHU inmates to reduce isolation and suicide risk, unless there is a compelling reason not to.
It outlines procedures for creating and enacting individualized Suicide Risk Management Plans for at-risk inmates.
